title: Possible path of electron through magnetic field

content.question: An electron is moving to the right, as shown in the figure above. It passes through the shaded region, which contains a magnetic field directed into the page. The electron travels along a path that takes it through point P. The gravitational force on the electron is negligible. Which of the following is a possible path of the electron?

choices.label: The figure presents a shaded square and the path of an electron. Point P is indicated near the bottom and to the right of the shaded square. The path is horizontal outside the square, and it enters the square at a point near the top of the left side of the square. The path then changes abruptly to a straight line down and to the right, that continues directly to point P.

The figure presents a shaded square and the path of an electron. Point P is indicated near the bottom and to the right of the shaded square. The path is horizontal outside the square, and it enters the square at a point near the top of the left side of the square. The path then changes abruptly to a straight line down and to the right that reaches the right side of the square at a location above point P. The path then changes abruptly again and moves more steeply down and to the right until it reaches point P.

The figure presents a shaded square and the path of an electron. Point P is indicated near the bottom and to the right of the shaded square. The path is horizontal outside the square, and it enters the square at a point near the top of the left side of the square. The path curves gradually downward and to the right at first, then it straightens out before reaching the right side of the square. This straight-line path continues directly to point P.

The figure presents a shaded square and the path of an electron. Point P is indicated near the bottom and to the right of the shaded square. The path is horizontal outside the square, and it enters the square at a point near the top of the left side of the square. The path curves gradually downward and to the right until it reaches point P.

content.answer: The figure presents a shaded square and the path of an electron. Point P is indicated near the bottom and to the right of the shaded square. The path is horizontal outside the square, and it enters the square at a point near the top of the left side of the square. The path curves gradually downward and to the right at first, then it straightens out before reaching the right side of the square. This straight-line path continues directly to point P.
